alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 9:55PM CDT until March 25 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR CHICKASAW...SOUTHERN CALHOUN AND WEST CENTRAL MONROE COUNTIES... At 955 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located over Embry, or 24 miles west of Montpelier, moving northeast at 65 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Houston, Calhoun City, Vardaman, Derma, Slate Springs, Prairie, Pyland, Trebloc, Houlka, New Houlka, Woodland, Sparta, Thorn, Van Vleet, Parkersburg, Thelma, Tabbville, McCondy, Anchor and Atlanta. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
